If you are from 2K22 and you are wondering if it is worth it, yes it is. There are minor improvements here and there that makes the gameplay so much better. To start, you have the new stamina and tired animations. It really adds depth and storytelling to the matches. Next, you also get smoother reversal and transition animation (no longer the leg sweep reversal over and over again). Graphics is a huge improvement while performance is better. CAWs having the new texture makes it on par with in game models and it looks good with the new sweat system (No longer having the plastic body with no sweat). AI is a huge improvement and no longer doing the same moves. 

All of the above are my favourite considering I only play Universe Mode majority of the time just like in 2K22. 

Only downside so far is the Showcase Mode which I understand why they didnt include commentary but man does it feel boring. I completed it very fast and it just feels like a chore to unlock all the bonus. 

If you are still in 2K22 but doubting, get it on sale. Next sale should be around 50% off during early September.

I've never really been much into professional wrestling, but I have some fond memories of playing some N64 WWF and ECW. I remember being around for the abysmal launch of 2k19 and joining on the dogpile over its terrible quality control. 

I never thought I would ever pick up an actual wrestling game until this one--and, as a non-fan of professional wrestling, I can say with blunt honesty that I think I'm coming around. My Youtube history is now almost completely comprised of watching clips of WWF/WWE moments in history. I never got distracted from when in 1998, the Undertaker threw Mankind off Hell in a Cell, and plummeted 16 ft through an announcer's table.

Memes aside, this is a really solid entry for the franchise. Creating a Wrestler is really intuitive, but there are some nagging blemishes I wish could have been addressed--like, how you can't use mouse controls when trying to dye hair, and that dying hair isn't based on clumps but rather just painted completely over as an overlay. Other than that, the customization options are pretty stellar and I eventually found myself spending a lot of time in the mode.

MyRise is a pretty decent experience, where you create a wrestler and take them through two separate stories--The Lock, being the male pro wrestler who's already made waves in the industry and comes to WWE seeking a champion's belt; and The Legacy, the niece of a former legend who has to wade through the universe of Diva and female wrestlers all looking for their own big break. Story's a bit middling but the fact that it's even here as a mode is deeply appreciated.

I don't care about MyGM; I haven't delved too deep into it but it looks similar to the Madden/FIFA Ultimate Teams bullcrap and I'm not about that life. 

WWE Universe, though, I think is the biggest start of the game single player-wise. This is basically the mode where you take WWE's programming and make it your own--you control the show, you set up the matches, you simulate what happens. You can throw in your own custom line-up of wrestlers and even put them in their own shows separate from RAW, Smackdown, or NXT. Or, of course, you can set up an entire season of shows where you can control your own custom wrestler and have them compete against the greats, the legends, and even hall of famers. All culminating in Wrestlemania, the top championship title.

All in all, WWE 2k23 is a fantastic package with some flaws. It's likely going to be replaced as soon as 2k24 comes out, fine, but for right now this version of the series is pretty solid as a game and wrestling sim.

Great game with tons of fun to be had. I haven't watched WWE since I was a kid and I can say that I feel right at home with the matches and characters. The showcase mode is largely disappointing however. Being a John Cena fan when i was younger, I was really looking forward to going through his best moments as I remembered them. The excitement soon ends when actually playing the matches though. No commentary from cena or the announcers bring the overall experience down. Total freedom in the matches you play are very limited. You, the player go through multiple forced checkpoints until you get to live footage (with no commentary) and you repeat this until the match is done. Other than that the game feels great overall when it comes to visuals and the game-play. Possibly the most realistic Sport game rivaling even the likes of FIFA and the NBA 2k series. 

The game is another good improvement in the series and it looks like the developers have good momentum.

This game has bizarre technical issues. My hours played is high because I've had to keep the game running overnight several times to clean up image data. 

You can only have 1000 custom graphics in the game, which sounds like a lot, but consider that these images are used for character portraits, tattoos, costume designs, title belts, and arena graphics, this adds up fast. About 50 characters, a handful of belts, and a few arenas will fill this up before you know it, and your goal of running a custom Universe are out the window. 

There are menu options in several modes that straight up don't work. Turning off stage elements in the arena builder, re-ordering rankings in Universe mode, and choosing to delete the aforementioned images when you delete an object that uses them simply do not function. The latter is maddening because deleting images manually is a time consuming mess. It can honestly take hours to do. 

Of all the hours I have in the game, I've played three matches. And that counts the tutorial match. I hope you like menus because you're going to be spending a lot of time navigating menus and waiting for loading screens before and after each press of the button.

Male Western moose stand anywhere from 1.9 to 2.0 metres (6.2 to 6.6 ft) at the shoulder. I love this game so much. It is a blast and runs great on the Steam Deck!

Got on sale and requested refund, although I've spent so long messing around with options and editing to change/fix things (that turn out couldn't be done) that I've probably lost that opportunity.  

Graphics are serviceable but really bland and likenesses are off - like barely recognisable fan-created custom fighters in a lot of cases, especially the 'legends' and most of the women. I purchased this for a multiplayer session and we spent most of that laughing at how strange everyone looks. 

Most attempts to recreate atmosphere fall completely flat - your final finishing move for example ending in silence until a few seconds when the crowd and commentator realise you've won.

There are so many pointless limitations making it very confusing to understand what you can change, who you can do it to and where it carries over. 

Decent game-play in a one-on-one exhibitions and a giggle with tag, royal rumble and war modes - but other, single player modes, are so broken - spent 3 hours in Universe and had the same opponent in every fight. Tried again with another character - and same again. Apparently I managed to win a title - but i don't recall being part of that.

The actual grappling is pretty good and the exhibition modes are great but everything else is jank, purposely limiting or just really really dull. Maybe if this other rubbish just wasn't available and there was no pretence of customisation I'd have been much happier and just put up with the other issues.

One of the best of the 2K WWE games in my opinion. MyGM is great, Universe is about as you'd expect, and in 40 hours I haven't ran into any bugs other than the occasional arm-through-the-rope physics glitch.

However, the male MyRise story ("Career Mode" if you're new to modern WWE games) is absolutely atrocious this year, in my opinion. Very early on, I won't spoil why, your character is kicked out of WWE and has to redeem himself by competing in fictional indie promotions against fictional wrestlers - basically, CAWs created by the developers. It's fun at first, and I won't spoil the ending, but the vast majority of MyRise is just playing against developer CAWs and low-tier midcarders like Noam Dar for hours on end with seemingly no purpose other than to spite WWE. It feels like an indie wrestling game that occasionally features WWE.

I recommend the game overall but if you play the 2K WWEs primarily for MyRise you're better off skipping this one.

Not gonna waste any extra time, folks. Let's do this review like it's gonna get us paid. Lol. It's not. Gaming isn't a job it's a hobby. Here we go: [1]. Almost the exact same roster as 2k22 aside from a hadful of new additions [Cody Rhodes is obviously in this edition, so far Bray Wyatt is MIA...]. But the roster is always what it is: A mix of the people who everyone loves, likes alot or wants to watch those ones beat on them more than some of the remaining roster types...No names, Jobbers if they prove to be that useful. Legends/icons of the WWF/WWE and have not set foot in a ring in years, have or still think they've got enough for one last run - to where? I wish I knew. But it's not to the main-event on the biggest stage of them all. My heroes are this age, it pains me to see them obviously hurting and beyond their expiration date by more than a couple years. Yeah I want these people when you start adding the filler and fluff content to make it look less idk less like a massive seasonal scam with a refreshed 2k Studios Logo and That Pro Wrestler of the currently supported edition with no guarantee the game will work during the year it's the most current title, and anything after that is 2kStudios Choice to deliver a finished playable product or whatever the state when they stop devoting even a barebones team to bug fixing and small updates to clean up code or fine tune a few minor gripes that look trash af so nobody can point to the mess that every 2k video game is by design. YES, 2k23 is in all ways an improved version of 2k22!!!! YEAH, for $120-130 a pop for the base game and all DLC/extras it SHOULD BE THOSE THINGS IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR DAY ONE RELEASE STATUS. Nobody wires and installs all the plumbing for a house that hasn't even been built. No other product or industry can put a partially completed, not-as-advertised product you can't even actually own or enjoy the illusion of doing so, it's a rental you must pay for, upfront, if you don't believe the item is what you were made to believe it to be , you are absolutely very unlikely to have a refund even considered beyond Steam's 2 hour countdown that's sped up to a cocaine-rabbit with 
 like a Cyberpunk 2077 Edgerunner using the Sandevistan deck mod. If you like 2k22 but want the finished version that's 97% playable? GET 2k23. Are you about fed up and looking for a way out of this hamster scam treadmill of diminishing hope and consumer rights being eliminated entirely? Yeah, I imagine we all are. But sometimes it's the closest  path back to the basic idea you paid to experience. And this is a difficult to simplify down to a yes buy or no don't waste the cash.   

*yes, Universe Mode is fixed
*myRise and MyFaction are not as sh*t as previous iterations
*MyGM is fine....It's much improved or nothing new depending if you are Pro or Con on this mode
*Load  Times ARE NOTICEABLY SHORTER and Less likely to hang
*Online multiplayer is not reliable and whatever they barely care
*Character creation tools are as per usual ++++
*Graphics seem less problematic
*Game save corruption bug STILL AN ACTUAL THING PEOPLE SAY IS HAPPENING....
*UI FEELS CLEANER AND MORE OR LESS IMPROVED
*Cody Rhodes is in the house so *shrug*


*VERDICT: Would recommend,but bedgrudgingly for a little longer while I put some hours into what is promising but with a caveat named 2KStudios....


P.S. I'd avoid the dlc until it's 70% off because as per industry standards it's junk ass no-one asked cuz no-one wanted it wrestlers and I'm starting a movement AGAINST expanded versions scam-the-consumer 9x every release "Season" I'm through, over it, fucking done with this system. Wrestling.. Wrestling never changes..

well in fact it does.. on one level, on others not so much. As it is a bit of a mirror of society. Including all the many lies in the business. But i digress.
WWE2K23 finally is a step upwards again, since a steady slope down for five years or longer. The newest version of WWE2K has quite acceptable graphics, a big roster and many small improvements, which makes the game finally fun to play again.
The Showcase is a nice enough change, in that you don´t have to always use the same person (Cena in that case), but can actually kick his ass. 
The MyRise let´s you choose between male and female superstar and their way to the top and both stories are quite entertaining, with even some options to choose from, how the story develops. Also you can use a pre generated Caw, something some players are happy about.
The match variety offers for the first time a War games match, which is nicely implemented and a wide range of other possible set ups, even including Tournaments etc.
Beside the graphics the animations were much improved in my oppinion, and many new are included.
The creating section is the most powerful up to date, you can create nearly everything on your own now. Which can be very time consuming of course. Good thing that they have improved also their online part, downloading (and finding the stuff) is quite stable and reasonable fast. Also online matches work quite well too. Even less understandable with this is, the year old limitation of 100 CAWs (and the seperate image limitation), which has no good reasoning at all anymore, except to annoy and limit players.

Universe and MyGM modes were also improved, where i have my second gripe though, why it doesn´t let you transfer created teams etc. through the modes. If you create Tag Teams in normal mode you have to repeat it for any other mode, which with the rising complexity of creation takes unnecessary long time.

Also WWE2K23 is still no bugfree experience, from crazy screen tears to whole pc crashes everything is possible. Still it makes a bit more stable impression.

Conclusio: Despite some old and unnecessary limitations, WWE2K23 is finally a step in the right direction. I can recommend it to nearly every wrestling game fan (despite a high price).

WWE 2K23 marks a significant leap forward for the long-running wrestling franchise, offering an engaging and immersive experience for both hardcore fans and newcomers alike. With improved gameplay mechanics, enhanced visuals, and a wealth of content, this installment proves to be a solid addition to the series.

Visually, WWE 2K23 is a stunning spectacle. The character models are incredibly detailed, with lifelike representations of the wrestlers. The arenas, crowd reactions, and lighting effects add a sense of realism that further immerses players in the world of professional wrestling. The attention to detail is commendable and contributes to the overall authenticity of the game.

One of the most notable improvements in WWE 2K23 is the revamped gameplay mechanics. The controls feel more responsive and intuitive, allowing for smoother and more fluid in-ring action. The addition of new animations and move sets adds variety to the matches, making each encounter feel unique and exciting. Whether you're executing high-flying maneuvers or delivering bone-crushing slams, the gameplay mechanics offer a satisfying and enjoyable experience.

The game offers an extensive roster, featuring a mix of WWE superstars, legends, and NXT talents. The inclusion of current and past wrestling icons allows players to recreate dream matches and rivalries, adding an extra layer of nostalgia and excitement. The creation suite is also impressive, enabling players to design their own wrestlers, arenas, and championships, fostering creativity and personalization.

The single-player modes in WWE 2K23 provide a compelling experience. The career mode allows players to embark on a journey as a rising superstar, complete with branching storylines and character development. The Universe mode returns, offering a deep and customizable experience where players can shape their own wrestling universe with rivalries, championships, and unpredictable twists.

However, WWE 2K23 is not without its flaws. Some players have reported occasional glitches and bugs, though these issues are expected to be addressed through future updates and patches. Additionally, while the gameplay has improved, there may still be room for further refinement and balancing to ensure a more realistic and strategic wrestling experience.

In conclusion, WWE 2K23 is a commendable entry in the long-standing franchise. With its enhanced visuals, refined gameplay mechanics, and extensive content, it provides an engaging and immersive wrestling experience. Despite some minor imperfections, this installment successfully captures the essence of the WWE universe and delivers a satisfying gameplay experience that will keep fans entertained for hours on end.

Review in progress...

On the up side:
-The menus load much faster than in 2k22.
-And the new skin textures do make CAWs look much more realistic, comparable to the in-game wrestlers.
-CAW entrances have had a few "lost" features make a return. It's nice to be able to edit the entrances in little chunks.

On the down side:
-While some characters look amazing, there are still a bunch that look like they've been rendered on a PS3.
-Why isn't there a feature in these games that allows you to port over your CAWs from the previous game?
-Numerous moves that were in the previous game have been removed.
-The menus are still really clunky, with numerous features hard to find and navigate to.
-Several features to change graphics settings seem to be completely broken or missing.
-Entrances still have bugs. Props that shouldn't be there, are. Props that should be there, aren't.
-Pyro doesn't seem to work for the most part.
-Lighting gets superceded by other entrance choices.
-There still that stupid MyFaction card game sh!t. And (like in 2k22) it's the first thing that pops up after the opening trailer.
-The Deletion Utility crashes me when I try to delete downloaded content from Community Creations.
-Where the F is the creation of custom tag teams and their entrances?!!?
-After almost a month trapped with permanent slow-motion, I've figured out the slow motion issue. Check to see if your computer Display Settings>Advanced Settings>Refresh Rate is set to 60. Unfortunately, now everything is normal speed, but in-ring action is super fast!!
very addictive 🤩 looking forward for more updates in the future .

Had a classic taste to it, loved the my rise story as 'the lock', even after giving myself small breaks between sessions, I would find myself getting invested in the story, often seeking revenge for something that's happened along side your super star. and the feeling of victory actually feeling good. Dived into it on legendary difficulty as its personally the best way to get into it if your familiar with the controls. Game can get hard but its one of those things that kept me invested, loved the grind I went through to get my guy up to max stats on his journey, sometimes feeling like a god compared to my opponents but the side curves kept me going, like suddenly your facing 2 on 1, or 3 on 1, or its a submission match, often having to beat the opponent beyond the Safety guidelines i'm sure WWE has, its simple but effective. Got me interested in the other 'my rise' story, will check it out and update review if I remember. 

Recommend if you like WWE and or just want a simple yet, complex fighting game. The 'the lock' Story is Great, the Showcase is great, although I haven't played this one, but based on previous WWE games they are usually done pretty well. Great work dev's, Much Respect.

The game is a rip off. 

By far the worst crime this terrible game has is the lack of customisation music. The stock music is garbage, uninspiring generic clown music. If you want music you actually like then you have to download some potentially risky program and then jump there a bunch of hoops to get something you actually want to hear. If you are unlikely like me and many others you wont have some .dlls needed for the program to work and you can either go get them or just give up in frustration like I did. Why the F*ck do they not allow customisation? So they can sell you more entrance music of course. 

The career mode is very formulaic with very few options and few you get are not really meaningful. Universe mode is quite boring and any rivalries you get are just random and without any sort of cause. The cut scenes are all very generic and shallow with zero narrative to anything. I've had the championship for several in game months and not once has there been a defence or an even an ability for me to cause a defence with the curate menu. 

Some of the mechanics of the game are ok but I really hate the timed button crap, its frustratingly unpredictable and doesn't match the movements of the people for the most part so its not like you constantly get caught off guard. The damn icons move around constantly, they also change size so you often don't even see them until its too late. 

During tag matches you have to go knock your opponents partner off the apron before you go for a pin because they ALWAYS get in and  interrupt before you useless partner can get in and stop them, even if do the pin in your own corner.  The ring is ridiculously small, it looks like one of those cheap rings independents use.

Didn't try the showcase mode because WTF would I want more Cena? After 10+ years of him being rammed down our throats, not interested in hearing, seeing or playing as him.
A very enjoyable game and the customization is great.

Token market has still not opened up Amethyst cards, and still haven't been able to obtain any evolution cards, except the 2 or 3 that came in/with the deluxe edition. faction wars is peaked out at 101 wins, I have already completed the story modes, and the showcase mode, and proving grounds, we need an update, it is feeling like an endless grind, for no real reward.

Ignoring the bugs from the launch, the game still has too many issues for me to give thumbs up. Universe mode has too many problems which you will find in most reviews.

While they keep on releasing DLCs and microtransaction buyable cards but people who want the FREE content (that was there from the start in 2k22) have to wait god knows how long. No communication or information provided.

It absolutely, utterly baffles me that this game has been getting so much more praise over 2k22 when it is such a steep downgrade.

2k22 was far from perfect, but the combat mechanics in this same like they've gotten worse. I just ran 7 matches in a row in Universe mode and EVERY match i played was filled with no less than 5 moments where the AI made me angry beyond belief. EDIT 2! Been playing for an additional 200+hrs, and have yet to experience save data issues again. just to be safe I've been backing up my saves in two seperate folders just in case, and everything's been fine! Still a major bummer though
BIG EDIT DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME: About 60HRS of game time after this review (194+hrs total) my save data got corrupted after a random game crash while loading a match. THEN a few days later just a few hours ago from righting this review I decide to start rebuilding my save. I played most of the Showcase Mode, adjusted the sliders, and began downloading CAWs from the Community Creations. While attempting to download a CAW of Tegan Nox the game crashes. Upon rebooting the game, I get the message that my save data has been corrupted yet again. another 4hrs down the drain. I have uninstalled the game and WILL NOT be playing this again until I hear of significant improvements to stability and the overall experience. Really turns me off from every spending money on a 2K title ever again. Absolute NO learning from past mistakes with this dev team it seems in some regards. 

First off, To give this game a rating for me, on a scale of 1-10 not using .5s I would give WWE 2K23 a 9/10.
I put about 136 hrs into this game in the first 2 weeks of it's release and have done almost everything there is to do for a decent amount of time to have come to a pretty solid conclusion. All-in-all, if you're wondering if this game is good than the answer in my opinion is YES! Easily the best WWE game with 2K in the title, and probably the best one since the first few SvRs on the PS2.

Before I go into each game mode available and break everything down, I'm gonna do pros and cons!
Pros:

-Very good overall gameplay and match quality
-Best match commentary ever seen in a WWE game
-Has the most robust sliders and options for tailor the gameplay to go exactly how you want such as:
      -Your usual Player and AI difficulty sliders that have always been in the games for years
      -New Sliders to adjust the difficulty of the Pin and Submission Mini-Games
      -New individual AI Sliders for every superstar in game or custom creation to control how often the wrestler will decide to do 
        specific move types, use their paybacks, and use other techniques when they are being controlled by the AI
-GREAT visuals (arenas, characters, lighting, etc)
-Good variety of deep game modes to sink your teeth into
      -Showcase Mode (a series of around 15 matches following the career of WWE Legend John Cena)
      -MyUniverse (a sandbox game mode where you can create your shows with your very own roster of superstars, tag 
        teams, champions, and so forth, and play through the never ending calendar of WWE programming. You can play it 
        like the sandbox it started as or select one superstar to play as throughout the years and see what rivalries you can 
        spark, and what championships you can win)
      -MyRise (this games version of the classic Season Mode where you can take any custom created superstar through the 
        usual WWE story-line process. Two paths are available to play; your male superstar's path "The Lock" and your 
        women's superstar's path The Legacy.)
      -MyGM (game mode where you take on the mantle of General Manager of your choice of 5 different brands(RAW, 
        SmackDown, WCW, NXT, & NXT 2.0) and go up against 1-3 other AI or Human controlled competing General 
        Managers and draft your rosters, book your shows, and battle for the most fans and money)
      -The Creation Suite of modes such as: Create a Superstar, Create an Arena, Create a Championship, Create a MITB 
       Briefcase, Create an Entrance, Create a Move-Set, Create a Match-Type, and Create a Show.
-Deep Roster of most of the major players in today's WWE programming
-A brand new match type for the series with the 3v3 and 4v4 War Games Match.
-The BEST Creation Suite out of any WWE game ever
-Cross-Platform Community Creations is back from last years game, meaning we can still upload, share, and download other 
  people's creations to use and customize in out own games.

Cons:
-The game is still pretty buggy like the last years game (2K22)
-Infrequent but random game freezes and crashes in areas where it probably shouldn't
-Lack of a deep Legends roster for those interested(I'm not so much)
-Still missing match type from passed games that fans have been begging for for years like: Special Guest Referee, 
 Casket/Buried Alive Match, Ambulance Match, and some more.
-Online Servers are abysmal. game crashes mid online matches and other activities. Upon loading the game there's seemingly a 50/50 chance of seeing an error message telling you the game failed to connect the online features. When that message does occur there is no way to connect to the servers besides closing the game entirely to reload the game and hope to whatever god or deity you believe in that it works. If it does work and you do connect however, in matches or in any other online mode you are still likely to disconnect. If you manage to not disconnect, but decide to go into an offline mode upon attempting to return to online after playing in the offline modes you will get that same message from before, telling you that an error occurred, and the game was unable to connect to the online services. Once again forcing you to close the game, and re-open in hopes to get connected again.
-MyFaction Mode. The mode itself is fine I guess; minus the micro-transactions. Oh yeah, and also minus all the hidden alternate attires/costumes for wrestlers that all LOCKED behind this game mode where you are very limited in as to what game modes/match types you can play. It's stupid and a clear ploy to get people to play the mode and spend money on purchasable in-game currency to buy packs of characters to use only in the MyFaction mode, in hopes that you unlock the action figure John Cena character(among many other alternate looks for superstars) that are un-playable anywhere else. 2K claim something along the lines that these costumes/attires are locked behind MyFaction because it's too much work to port them into other game modes outside of MyFaction due to limitations. Which is just preposterous. 

OKAY! I THINK** that wraps up my Pros and Cons portion of the review. I'm going to add a more in-depth breakdown of all the main game modes and give my thoughts on those, but that will be edited into my review probably in the next few days. I'm going to sleep now.

Ratings 
Graphics - 8/10 
Lost points because - The time period was mid 2000s and Fight Night by EA had boxers sweat visible, realtime facial damage detailed and visible, bleeding detailed and visible - these are just 3 points as an example. Many more around crowd, clothes, weapons etc.

Gameplay - 7/10 
Stuck between sim and arcade. Random FPS drops. Occasional glitches. Undeveloped AI and incomplete pathfinding where they can't go get a weapon at times and get stuck while trying to do, can't exit in elimination chamber and royal rumble, no realism when it comes to fatigue or injury demonstration etc.

Content - 5/10 
WCW content absent. ECW content absent. Prior iterations did way better in this area. 2K needs to learn and if it s a WWE problem then they need to find a way to convince. Irrespective their product will be rated as such by those who want that content. Many matches previously present in game now missing. Simple stuff like special referee is absent. Creation options not back to 100% as the benchmark has existed in the license franchise. This is 2023 and why can't we have Survivor Series 5 vs 5?

Replayability - 8/10 
Thanks to community creations which means the developers and the publishers get a free ride on this rating. GM mode can better and ore detailed. Essentially a half baked release. 

Originality/Newness - 3/10 
Wargames. Other points are just borrowed from previous iterations. 

The good 
Game works sometimes and doesn't cost $1000

The bad 
Missing match types and characters that must be present in base game are offered as season pass. 

The ugly 
Bugs. Game breaking bugs. Glitches. Game breaking graphical glitches. Limited game modes like GM mode which are under developed and released as if a prototype. Lot of content in terms of arenas, images, names and terms, WCW, ECW content and related commentary is completely missing. Why should we shell $100 and be happy with such a product year after year when you refuse to increment the offering substantially over collective previous iterations. MyFaction pay to win and collect exclusive attires etc is a very poor concept. This is not a mobile game. 

Should you buy? - Compared to previous iterations and other titles 
No, not if you own the classic titles in the series and don't care about these graphics. Else get it on sale and make a list of all great community creations for more fun.

I can't recommend this game after playing it for 200 hours.  The control scheme is excellent but the controls are unresponsive and stiff.  The stamina system is a great idea implemented horribly wrong.  Currently, the stamina system they have built into the game is completely unrealistic and kills the immersion by a huge margin.  The wrestler's get fatigued too quickly and slow down too fast.  It really disrupts the pace of the action and kills any momentum you were building with long attack sequences.  After about 3 or 4 minutes of action, the wrestlers are often too exhausted to run and if they are too exhausted to run then they are too exhausted to perform any running attacks or aerial moves.  That totally sucks.  And so the action almost comes to a halt when you can no longer run at your opponent.  Although, the animations look really good when they are tired and flailing about.  MyRise is a big disappointment because the writing is terribly cringe and your characters journey through the WWE universe is largely pointless and uninspiring.  Just bad writing through and through for both male and female MyRise stories.  MyGm is a huge disappoint and not worth the time.....same goes for MyFaction.  

Overall, the game gets a score of 6 out of 10.  The crazy thing is that 2K22 has far more engaging and memorable wrestling action than 2K23!!!  It's mainly because there is no stamina system to slow down the action in that game and 2K22 has much better superstar entrances.  Becky Lynch's entrance has been modified heavily to be less inspiring, and Ric Flair's entrance is crap compared to his entrance in 2K22, and many other wrestler's from the previous game have better entrances than they do in the new version of the game.  WTF, 2K!!?!?  A few of the fan favorite wrestlers have been dropped completely for no good reason.  For instance, I know that the IIconics were released from the WWE but that's no reason to remove them entirely from the game.  Bret Hart, Macho Man, and British Bulldog have uninspiring entrances as well.  The character model for Bret Hart doesn't even look like him in the slightest.  

Overall, the unresponsive controls and the minimal upgrades to the various game modes isn't enough to warrant a $60 price tag and 2K knows this.  The best advice for any wrestling fan is to ignore this installment and wait a few years for 2K25 to come out.  These incremental improvements to the game aren't nearly enough to warrant a purchase at this time.  Another thing I just found out is that Vince McMahon isn't impressed with 2K23 either.

I had a blast the first few weeks that this game has been out. I loved the Showcase Mode, "The Lock" MyRise mode and the Community Creation Suite. However the bugs and flaws in "The Legacy" MyRise and in Universe Mode really killed the experience for me.

Since the Smackdown VS. RAW 2011, Universe Mode was my favourite pass time in these games (besides Road to Wrestlemania). It's the one mode I always play for hours on end, but the 2k version of this mode is a shell of its former self. This version may have new features but is somehow more buggy than any other year prior. Title Matches not happening despite you or the A.I. booking them, Match Cards changing without input and Superstar Mode being a buggy mess to name the big ones.

Now I'm not someone who cares for modern GM Mode, hence no mention of it here. And I thought MyFaction is a waste of time.

For "The Legacy" MyRise, I only have two concerns. One minor and one game breaking. First, the Voice Actress for the Women's Superstar is very annoying but I can easily look past it. I don't doubt she is a talented individual but this is not her best work. Now for the game breaker, you can't progress past the side quest with Bianca. (For those who don't know what I'm referring to, you and Bianca fight over Company Merch rights and profits.) Once that arc wraps up, you're just stuck in the medical room. Nothing available. (Before people ask, yes I checked the Notifications and Social Media Feed in the UI. I did this one last before I had the next story mission).

I really wanted to give this a positive rating, but the more I play this entry the less I feel obligated to come back. I keep finding more quirks about this game that hinders the overall experience.

Honestly, this game is a lot of fun. I've really enjoyed the time that I was able to play.
That said, my save was corrupted and I lost 10hrs of gameplay. Now the game won't save at all and I'm trying an uninstall/reinstall.

Bottom-line:
If your game corrupts saves and won't create a new one, it's not ready for release.
Give this game at least six months and/or get it discounted during a steam sale...

Edit/Update:
I resolved the corrupted save issue on my install and recreated my CAWs again.
The game is still fun, but having to set up a save file backup schedule is pretty BS.

Just in case another reader has the same issue:
1. Turn off Steam Cloud saves for 2K23 (you'll have to back up your own save files)
2. Exit Steam. 
3. Browse to your Steam userdata folder 
    Example: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\userdata\[steam profile id]
4. Rename, move, or delete the 1942660 folder.
5. Open Steam & launch 2K23 to create a new save.
6. Start from scratch again.

WWE 2K23 is an outstanding sports game that delivers on all fronts. The game's visuals are impressive and the in-ring combat mechanics are solid, creating an immersive and exciting experience for players. The abundance of modes available in the game provides players with a wealth of options to explore, keeping the game fresh and engaging even after multiple playthroughs.

One of the game's greatest strengths is its attention to detail. The characters are well-designed, and the animations are fluid and realistic, making it feel like you are watching an actual wrestling match. The audio is also well-done, with a fitting soundtrack and appropriate sound effects that enhance the gameplay experience.

Overall, WWE 2K23 is a fantastic addition to the WWE/2K Sports franchise. It is a must-play for fans of wrestling and sports games in general. With its impressive visuals, solid combat mechanics, abundance of modes, and attention to detail, WWE 2K23 is a grand slam that is sure to delight both fans and newcomers to the franchise.

I have not played a wrestling game in a very long long time. The last one I have ever owned is WWE 13 for the WII, and did not buy any of the WWE 2K games until this one. I heard a lot of good things and honestly there's a lot here for you money. From two different MyRise Stories, to the John Cena Showcase, to Universe mode which is as always is either the most boring or funniest mode in the game because you can practically book whatever you want in that mode. To the the return of my personal favorite mode MyGM mode. Which takes you behind the scenes and shows you what running a show is like. Which is awesome.  Now for the rankings:

1.) Roster- which outside of the small nitpicks I have which is not including certain legendary wrestlers like Ric Flair or the Road Warriors, I think it deserves a lot of credit for what it does have, Its at the very least a 7 out of 10, due to the amount of wrestlers you have access to outside of creation and unlockables.

2.) Gameplay- For me this is the most important aspect of this game how do playing matches actually feel. Well to me they play great. They are fun, loose and easily can suck you in for hours. Especially when the game makes it feel like a real wrestling match is going on. One complaint that I have is it gets very techincal very fast and it feels a little to complicated for what this game is but in all game play is a 7 out of 10

3.) Content- As mentioned above there is a load to do in this game, you have traditional play now, two separate stories, showcase and two modes where you can become head Booker. Lets go through each mode. Play now is as excellent as you would want it to be. Play whatever match type you want and play with whoever you want, where you want. MyRise, has a ton to it, however the boring side matches can feel a little repetitive at times. I am not all the way through my play through of those stories but so far I have enjoyed their concepts.  Showcase, is a fun side mode for players, its actually surprisingly immersive mode. It takes you from match to match and even does cut-scenes and shows you what happens in the actual matches from that era and then flows back to the matches.  Next up is GM mode and Universe mode, I lump these together because they are very similar while also remaining different. Universe mode is where you put yourself not just as GM but as owner of WWE and can set up everything. GM Mode is more restricted but allows you to be in control of contracts, feuds and so much more to the point it feels like you are more involved with the show. So in short this to me is a ton of fun fruitful content to sink into without going into MyFaction(ultimate team but with wrestlers) in that vein Id say its a solid 8 out of 10 when it comes to the content in Game

Final Verdict: WWE 2K23 is worth every dime you want to spend on it, whether you wait for it go on sale or not. There is plenty of content, an a amazing creation suite and fun game play all over the place. However it has issues with a roster that feels empty without certain legends some parts of the content loop in the modes feeling either tedious or boring. It has a lot here that it kinda overwhelms the negative. For me its a solid 7.5 to an 8 out of 10.

I give this a hesitant recommendation.
I won't say no because I believe that with 2K22 they had a fire lit under them to prove they aren't completely incompetent at producing a decent game and making the experience feel fresh and fun.
With 2K23 it feels like a slight upgrade but I have noticed a few creeping old bugs slipping back in and still room for improvement and polish.
There are some characters that feel unique and handle in a special way that is refreshing in a sea of wrestling games whereby all the roster handles far too similar with just variants of move animations, to have characters that have handling that makes them move and flow differently from others is the way forward, that way matches don't feel like cookie cutter matches with the only differences being visual but how speed can help or hinder differently dependant on who you face.
Matches between two behemoths smashing each other in a slow short powerful hoss match or the flips and high risk dives of cruiserweights in a fast paced adrenaline rush match and everything between feels like things are heading in the right direction, It can feel arcadey but at the same time you can pace things out for a more simulation style, I feel there is a good balance here of both which satisfied a wider audience.
There is much room for improvement in many ways, backstage needs some attention in this regard, there's a reason Here Comes the Pain gets a lot of love, the wild and wacky side of things is not something to shy away from, it is a game afterall and if someone prefers to play things more serious then that option is already there to just not take things to the sublime and keep it in the ring.
More freedom is needed in the options, I feel there could be more trust in the player to take responsibility when it comes to creating matches, even if the options chosen don't make sense to the devs, don't mother us, we are capable of deciding if we want to play a 2 out of 3 steel cage escape only with KO's on and first blood option on, let US decide, if we mess up making a stupid stipulation match or rules that don't gel then that is on us, we don't need hand holding restrictions.
I could go on forever on simple changes that would make things more fun that remain in the realistic realms of the available resources and the limitations or restrictions of the engine but why bother, the customer is always wrong it would seem when it comes to the blind spot of developers, not restricted to any one company.
The presentation is crisp and straight forward, the menus intuitive enough and load times seem to be improved this year for us impatient types.
I do wish for the Universe to receive some real love, sure you can throw in a few animations now, but it still feels restricted and neglected, I long ago found the Universe mode which should be the bread and butter foundation of the WWE games to be a lost cause, shame really, I fear this is because it provides no cashcow to milk unlike the my faction mode, I long gave up trying to fight against games taking the nosedive to greed modes burying the rest of the game, it would seem given the earnings of EA's ultimate team that its a losing battle, all we can hope for now is that there will be some sort of natural progression of companies splitting their groups into two camps, one that works on keeping games offline and single.local multiplayer friendly and fresh and the other half can dance around in the dark gambling and squeezing the customers wallet side of things.

Oh the game, yeah its still got enough to keep you going, if you're a casual player that just wants a game to pick up and have a blast with you should have enough here but maybe when it hits half price or something, the my faction is fun to play but if you don't intend on spending cash then expect a very very unsatisfying grind for what will likely be hours to earn enough for a pack of cards that will be eaten up as duplicates (conveniently) of jobbers and mid carders, don't expect any decent rosters here unless you have money to burn.

Bugs are becoming a bit frequent again, is two years going to have to be the norm? I fear the games are going to become stagnant and buggy moving forward again if the yearly releases become "how can we milk the my faction suckers" direction.

In all seriousness, this game truly is fantastic.  I've had NO issues with this game whatsoever and I mod songs into the game for themes/background music with zero issues, no crashes.  The weird bug where if you have a universe mode full of community creations essentially softlocking the game is gone from 2k22.  The magnetic ropes from 2k20 and 2k22 (while dialed down not quite there) are done.  This game is what 2k20 and 2k22 was DESPERATELY trying to be.  If you go through the games I own, you'll see I very much am a fan of the WWE 2K series.  I can EASSSSSILY say they knocked it out of the park with 2K23!!!  They even FINALLY removed that arbitrary 20 downloads per 24hr period lockout!!  2K23 is the game I've been waiting for since seeing the direction they were going post 2K19, I can download to my hearts content, the universe mode (both single and classic mode) are fantastic and they're finally truly fixed.  The John Cena showcase is pretty good!  You're always the guy beating Cena!!!!  I'm so glad they went in that direction instead of you playing as Superman himself, it means they understand the fans would rather beat on him then play as him.  And I'm glad John was cool enough and open enough to talk about these matches and what they meant to him, that behind the curtain look that WWE has been providing it's fans for a while now is always awesome.

The graphics are better than 2K20 and 2K22, but they're not otherworldly, you'll know what to expect if you've played the recent entries.  7.5/10

Gameplay is fantastic, aside from barbed wire matches, casket match, and inferno match, 2k23 has every match type, including WARGAMES.  OHH!!  They kept the combo system from 2K22!  I was really hoping they would and they did.  If you played 2K22 and are familiar with the combo system, you'll know exactly what to do.  WWE 2K23 is essentially a working and improved 2K22 and I'm 1000% here for it.  Still no more OMG Moments, I don't know why that was removed but most of those moves have been incorporated into normal moves.  The 5 star system is still around, it's exactly as it's been no real changes there.  From what I've experienced multi-man matches can still be a bit of a cluster-F at times but the AI has been improved enough that it doesn't happen all that often.  The overly aggressive AI trying to attack while you were in the middle of a move, negating your move in an unblockable fashion has been turned WAYYYYYYYYY down.  It does still happen, but it's a 2/10 if it was cranked to a 10/10 before.  The AI does pretty much what you see on tv, everyone kinda goes to the outside and 2 people are in the ring and people kinda fight their way in and out of the spotlight and when everyones beat to snot you get the cover after cover stuff.  

My Rise, I haven't played the female character yet but the male character Lock is pretty good.  You join a faction but it doesn't go well, you get fired and work the indies for a while before working your way back into the WWE and trying to get to the top.  That's about as much as I can tell you without spoilers. I will say this though, the character dialogue is still terrible, but the road you travel is really cool.

Universe mode is where it's at for me, because I don't like having random matches that don't mean anything, I want to develop rivalries and see where the story goes and who wins/loses and that's what Universe mode is.  Classic mode is exactly what you played as in previous entries, where you not only book 100% of the shows but you play the matches as well, and Single is where you follow the career path of 1 wrestler and can't change.  

For me this is a 10/10.  This is better than WWF No Mercy, WCW nWo Revenge, all the N64 wrestling games that are touted as the best ever.

[h1] Looks similar to WWE2K22 but WWE2K23 is Better [/h1]

[b]Pros[/b]
-New superstars
-Improved CAS models (looks like in-game models)
- They added realistic blood and sweat you can clearly see how those react during the match.
-Added extra new matches and more features to GM mode
-Improved Universe mode
-You can choose to decide which path to take in Universe mode and see the cutscenes accordingly
-Good My Rise 
-Pin system is good on this one
-Added a Balancing system for matches
- I have yet to see any poor in-game models except for Becky Lynch ( they picked the wrong attire and makeup for her)
- I have never encountered any bugs yet
-Crashes stopped after the latest patch 

[b]Cons[/b]
- Showcase mode is something i don't care about (it locks unlockable behind it so I have to play, but it's not for me)
-Community creation is the best feature but connects rarely and has network issues.
-Some models can be found outdated 

other than that I think it was a very polished and smooth experience. I really loved the game

If you have any interest in creating custom wrestlers, entrances, videos, etc.....this game is absolute trash.    There was a lot of fanfare about how they've added more advanced creation elements....they should have left them out.   Having them in and not work is worse than not having them at all.   It's amazing to me that I can go back to play WWE2k14, and I can customize everything in that game and it works....now, almost 10 years later with new technology, it's worse.    Aren't we supposed to be improving things???      I've had the game crash multiple times during character customizations.  And the entrance creator just doesn't work....it's a pure guessing game, because the Preview does not reflect at all what you've chosen or what displays in the actual game play.    If you don't care about that stuff, might be ok...but if you like to create new stuff in the game, then I'd recommend a hard pass.

Last time I played and owned a WWE game was I believe 06. I feel little has changed since then. I guess the company decided on a recycle/copy and paste approach. I purchased this solely for the multiplayer option but players either quit if they're losing or disconnect for a variety of other reasons leaving you with bots. Not enjoying it starting off so no reason to waste the money for it since I can only see myself hating it more down the line. *Refunded.

EDIT: It looks like you can correctly play online now, at least its working for me, so you can play all the modes, now it is worth of its price

It needs more modes like Special referee and other special matches, but the real reason why I changed from recommending it to don't it's cuz the game is half of what it said that it offers. What I mean is that servers roughly work in PC, and for what I had read it was the same in 2k22 so it doesn't look like 2k wants to fix anything. Modes like multiplayer, MyFaction, Community Creations and more are useless and have to reset the game like 3 or 4 times until it lets you play, and Always kicks you out after a while, so no, I don't recommend this game until they don't fix the servers, paying what the game costs for half of the content that it should have is a definitive NO.
If u don't really care about community creations, playing online, playing MyFaction and just want to play MyRise, Showcase and Exhibition matchs, then of course go for it! But I would never recommend for paying just for those three modes the entire price.

Judging from the Single Player side of things, this is an amazing wrestling game. 

The gameplay is fluid and fun to play, and we PC players finally, FINALLY get the next-gen version (if you have a strong enough GPU). 

My only gripe so far is that we have locked 30fps entrances, changing the action cam setting doesn't change that. However, it does affect the cuts in the middle of the match (for example finishers) so those will be in 60fps. 

The MyRISE mode is great and truly tailored for wrestling fans, this is the best wrestling career mode I've played in a long time (Both The Lock and The Legacy), but 2K, just please let us have more "choice" and endings next year. Yes, there are branching paths in MyRISE, but you have only one ending in the Lock, despite the branching paths. The storytelling is great, however, and I felt fully immersed. I loved it.

As per usual, the customization options are AMAZING. You can literally create anyone.

Graphics are beautiful, it truly feels like you're actually watching WWE.

Online is something I won't touch on. I'm not an online player. However, I will say, it does take some time for community creations to load up, but I think that's normal.

Overall a 8.9/10 from me. Best wrestling game we've had in years, 2K22 laid a strong foundation, and 2K23 just continues to build up from it. Hoping 2K24 takes it further. I finally enjoy wrestling games again. It seems the dark ages of the game that must not be named (2K20) are over... for now at least.

great game

**GAME BREAKING GLITCH** 

I really want to give this game a "Thumbs Up" and a positive review. However, at every opportunity where I began to have fun I encounter some kind of issue/crash. With the final straw being a game breaking glitch in "My Rise" mode where the only solution is to completely restart the game. With the game in this current state I simply cannot recommend it, at least for PC and or Steamdeck.

When It comes to the combat and presentation in WWE 2k23 it's awesome. At least when it works, if you're not caught in infinite loading screen, a permanent black screen, or your game doesn't crash in the middle of a match, or in my case have a glitch completely break your story progression in the "My Rise" mode. The "Showcase" mode with John Cena is engaging and awesome and really shines and was enjoyable to me while I played it. "My Rise" mode up until it's demise was a fun experience and interesting enjoy story lines and voice acting that I didn't feel insulted playing it and even looked forward to my next match and story mission.

Unfortunately, there are branching paths in "My Rise" mode and one of them is a path where you can team with Randy Orton optionally in a faction - if you do this and you're playing on a imported created wrestler you're locked into a scenario where you must complete a tedious button prompt to advance the storyline. Unfortunately, you cannot no matter what you do get this to work despite doing the right command if you are on a imported created wrestler. There are threads on the internet dating back since the release over 3 weeks ago and numerous previous patches where this has been happening and gone unfixed. The only solution to this problem and game breaking glitch is to completely start over or avoid this path and hope it doesn't happen on other potential story line paths in the game. It's a shame because without these bugs you have a great game and one of the best wrestling games in years.

I really hope future patches can fix up this game so I can update my review as It's enjoyable.... when it works... which is... not as much as it should.

I don't know how else to say it. This game has the best storymode of a sports game I've ever played.

WWE 2k23 starts off by choosing between "The Legacy" and "The Lock". The Legacy is about a second-generation wrestler that has to live up to the expectations of having already been growing up in the business. "The Lock" is about an already-established wrestler that has to make it through the WWE "superstar making machine".

By the time of writing this review, I've fully completed "The Legacy" - and it was an incredible experience. Voice-acting and the actual story is genuinely really good. You're also faced with a surprising amount of choices. I think there's 3 major decisions, and the rest are somewhat minor - but the "minor" decisions still has a short-term impact, such as your next opponents or whether you come off as a face or heel. All these minor decisions all come together in a honestly beautifully done way towards the end. Especially the last two matches are absolutely incredible.

Where WWE2k23 becomes truly great for me, is that the new combat system have hit a perfect balance for me. I'm a veteran, and on the hardest difficulty the latter matches organically created a lot of situations commonly seen in actual matches. You truly feel like you become a good wrestler by the end of the game.

Finally, I need to reiterate that The Legacy' story is really strong. Especially Molly Holly & Justine' voiceacting and roles in the story is written just right. It feels real, genuine - and that's probably because it kind of is. Any long-term fan in the landscape would recognize a lot of story-elements from actual events.

I'm playing through The Lock atm. which surprised me that I'd even care to do - but that's how good this game is. Might do a proper review then.

Steam Deck Review!

While this game does say “unsupported” and “unverified” for the Steam Deck, I would like to inform you that this game runs properly and smoothly— well in certain aspects it does. Playing select matches with multiple wrestlers in the ring, the game does take a bit of a performance hit, though it is still playable. Running this game at its highest graphical fidelity also causes frames to drop and draining on your battery. The fans on the Deck will start to kick and you’ll see your battery drop. At medium settings, this game is just as good and probably the best way to play. 

Overall: Playable, 7 out of 10.

Is it better than WWE2k22 on Steam Deck?
Yes and you don’t need to be offline to play this game. You can play online and run the game without it crashing.

As time goes on with the game, I will continue to update this review to ensure you guys are getting the best experience or making a safe choice/decision so you can enjoy your purchase.

Thank you!

"Hey there, wrestling fans and wannabe WWE superstars! Do you like spending your free time staring at error messages and feeling your blood pressure rise? Then have I got the game for you! WWE2K23's online mode is about as reliable as a wrestler's memory after getting hit on the head with a steel chair. You'll spend more time waiting for a connection than John Cena spends reciting his catchphrase. And when you finally do connect, it's about as stable as a sumo wrestler doing a handstand.

The online mode is so unreliable, it's like trying to pin a greased-up pig while blindfolded. It's like the game is mocking you, daring you to try to get a stable connection. It's like the game is saying, "Hey, you think you're tough enough to handle WWE2K23 online? Think again, chump!"

You'll have more connection issues than Stone Cold Steve Austin has beers. You'll feel like a jobber getting beaten down by a main eventer every time you try to connect to the game's servers. So, unless you enjoy feeling like a loser more than The Miz enjoys staring at himself in the mirror, I suggest you pass on WWE2K23 and spend your money on something more reliable, like a rusty folding chair or a used wrestling mat from the local YMCA."

WWE 2K22 was and still is amazing. WWE 2K23 isn't much different which is absolutely a good thing because the actually wrestling portion of the game is super fun. Of course the main changes here that you'd want to see as your main content, the changes you pay for since 2k22 and 2k23 are mostly the same. John Cena Showcase mode which is pretty good, It's longer than the Rey Mysterio Showcase but It's not quite as good since John Cena doesn't talk about his matches during the clips like Rey did in 2K22. MyRise is probably the biggest change and honestly It's so much better than the MyRise in 2K22, even though Showcase is a tiny bit worse(It's still good) MyRise went from an unbearable slog to an actual interesting story mode. Character creation is a bit better, Load times are WAY faster all over the game and all the game modes I haven't mentioned are still good. Is It worth purchasing at full price? I say it's a cautionary yes, while you'll definitely get your money's worth out of the game and the game IS extremely fun. I would still say weigh your options before purchase. If you didn't play 2K22 at all then it's a definite must buy.

WWE 2K23, the update for WWE 2K22. There isn't much added in terms of content, new game mode is Wargames, and that is it. Slight improvements to MyGM and creations, how ever creations mode is prone to crash very often. Just like in WWE 2K22 there are wrestlers and unique models locked behind MyFaction. Showcase mode is quite fun, this time you play as the opponent in all the matches with the goal to defeat the many different versions of John Cena. WWE Universe mode is the exact same as WWE 2K22, but with more crashes. The servers are non-existent in this game. The game has a 90% to give you a server error on launch, and the only way to reconnect is to exit the game completely. When the servers do work, you have 5 minutes to play on the server before it gives another server error. Because of this there are only 2-3 online matches a day and those players and you won't stay connected long. 2K needs a reality check, this will be my last WWE wrestling game unless it's made by another studio, 2K has not learn their lesson with the failure of 2K20 and are repeating their terrible old habits. If anyone is interested in playing the game, wait for a sale and buy the normal edition with the season pass separate. I guarantee you won't use the Icon Edition's content, especially the MyFaction content because you won't be able to connect to it to use the content. Wait for a sale, wait for the AEW game, and wait for Ultra Pro Wrestling game to come out(WWF No Mercy successor).

This is a more polished version of WWE 2K22 and, at first glance, doesn't seem to pack enough improvements into this new package to justify another full retail purchase. However, once you play for a while, it becomes clear that many of the systems from last year have grown in depth and interactivity. The new kick out system is a lot of fun and makes it possible for even the unlikeliest of false finishes to take place. They double down on this kick out system by adding a "sweet spot" on the kick out meter that not only allows you to escape the pin fall attempt, but to reverse it into one of your own. Universe mode is perhaps the biggest improvement over last year. For each match in a rivalry, you can select from dozens of possible events that could take place to further the story. These are not guaranteed however, because your opponent also gets to pick how these events may unfold. Which selection is ultimately used is decided by the digital equivalent of a coin flip. Even if you win the coin flip, it is still possible that events will not go your way. For example, if you choose to attack your opponent with a steel chair after the match, losing said match will result in your opponent turning that chair against you. The player agency offered in this year's Universe mode is exactly the kind of creative freedom I've always wanted. Additional changes include, but are not limited to, weapon taunts, the ability to assign springboard moves as finishers or signatures and impressively up-to-date character models and animations. Sami Zayn had only turned against the Bloodline a month or so before this game launched, yet the character model had his updated shirt with duct tape over the word "Uso." Other character models are less contemporary. Austin Theory, for example, still has his much maligned selfie gimmick and is rated in the lower 80s. His current push isn't taken into account at all. Still, these are minor complaints, considering older WWE2K games used to freeze time at the previous WrestleMania and try to reflect the state of WWE at that time. The fact that even some things are updated here is a leg up over previous iterations. I felt some buyer's remorse when I first booted up this game. It felt like the same game with a new title. A few dozen hours of playtime quickly changed my mind though and I'm very happy with this year's edition of the WWE 2K franchise.

My save got corrupted because of a forced steam update while I was downloading a CAW, and now every time I start up the game it think I'm loading it up for the first time. So that's hours of CAWs, Titles, shows, arena's, Universe Mode progress, My GM Progress,  MyRise Progress, Showcase mode progress (which has attires/things you can only get by playing the mode)  that is now just GONE & I can't get back until whatever this issue is gets patched. I did some research & saw that this was happening to people in 2k22, which means they just didn't care to bother to truly play test this to make sure it doesn't happen. All they did was pay Ytbers to promote the very few new features from the game. I've never had as much of a technical issue w/ these games before EXCEPT for 2k20...and it's sad I'm talking/feeling comparisons to that POS game. This game is just a slightly upgraded version of 2k22 & but somehow feels worse imo. Still has almost the exact same issues & glitches & bugs as 2k22. I don't hate the hybrid fighting/wrestling game controls, but they overall don't make sense since alot of the moves in the game can be assigned as both heavy & light attacks so you can't truly gauge what button to press to parry.  The rivalry system is Universe mode, is nice but some of the descriptions for the "rivalry actions" don't fully explain enough what or who will be doing the action. But that's the only attention that mode got. MyGM just feels like a more toxic version of Mario Party now, designed to make you hate your friends for screwing you over, it doesn't help w/ the card system & giving someone like Xavier Woods the most OP GM card in the whole mode. All they added was 1 match type, and a few new features but other than that, it's still not as great as it's been hyped to be. These games for years now have had the pattern of taking one step forward & five steps backwards & I think I'm officially over it. If this doesn't get patched them I'm officially requesting a refund & it better be granted b/c it's just criminal at that once again, 2k pulled some shit like this. I feel 2k22 is the staple at this point that they need more time making these games, because this just feels like a joke at this point this pattern they have developed.

Ok. This one feels much better than the last one.[b]GM mode[/b] is better much, even tho not quite there yet. The after season draft sucks (you really just gonna leave me with 3 superstars and let all other, well rested and super popular, superstars get yonked by other brands?) 2008 covered it better IMO (other braands got to steal 3 of your superstars while you could shield some from getting stealed iirc). And something special for RR, SS, MITB and WM would be most appreciated (as 2008 used to have).[b]Universe mode[/b] underwent some good changes. Superstar mode actually makes some sence in this one (still can't change divisions by any means tho - even ttho you can change brands with no problem).[b]MyRise[/b] seems cool too. The UI is similar to last year's while story is seems better crafted (rather than just leaving you with nothing randomly clicking through storylines).Gameplay-wise it feels bit odd. Not sure why. I could've played (with good success rate) any WWE games on Legend difficulty (since 2008 - even the last one where they changed controls - for a worse imo) but something is off in this one. Maybe reversals changed? More rock-paper-scissors based reversals? Or maybe I'm just imagining things. Either way - can't play on Legend no more :P.[b]MyFaction[/b] mode, to my disappointment, is still in the game, still crazy grind (even worse than before actually) and is still part of achievements. They 'improved' it. This time you actually have a reason to grind it/spend money, cause there is an on-line mode. And that on-line mode is the exact reason why you (or me at very least) won't get 100% achievements. Win 100 online matches?! I managed to join ONE match. It was laggy and then we got disconnected. Since that attempt I did not get matched with single person. Maybe it's an Europe thing, but it's crushing my collector's soul.

As someone who hasn't played 2k games for a very long time (I played a lot of pre 2k WWE games on ps2) it's been pretty fun, the 2 story modes are fleshed out well enough for it to be an enjoyable experience having completed both legacy and the lock 'My rise' stories.GM mode has the potential of being a great fun mode to play alone or with friends, however the class system implemented is awful. the draft system is cool with how each superstar has a budget which loosely correlates with their ratings and popularity, however it all falls apart when you realise you'd be better off just putting a 'Giant' versus a 'cruiserweight' for the sake of having some arbitrary boost in match quality. I'd put on rivalries that I thought would be great as a fan of the product only to get beaten by a ridiculous rivalry of 'Cruz del Toro' versus 'Shanky'. this took me out of the action a bit, but i can see this mode being a lot with a friend.Overall i'd recommend this game for someone that enjoys the WWE product and hasn't played a WWE game for a while.

All I wanted out of this iteration of WWE 2K was a more fleshed out MyGM mode and this game delivers on that. Much more variety in match styles and variants (although a trios tag would have been nice), midcard titles, new power cards and a larger variety of GMs and shows to run all make MyGM much more enjoyable compared to WWE 2K22.

Outside of MyGM, the CAW system is probably the best I've seen in a 2K game yet. If you're sick of waiting for Fight Forever, the community has you covered with tons of AEW stars modeled in the CAW feature that look and play great. War Games makes it's debut here and it's a very fun match-type perfect for experimenting with different team and opponent combos for some chaotic fun. There's enough additions and changes here that I think 2K23 is a very worthy upgrade from 2K22, I'd recommend it to any wrasslin fan out there

Bought this to relive some of the old fun had in the older games (pre 2010) and it worked out nicely. Controls took a hot minute to get used to, but overall I have had a really good experience with this game.

The online aspects is non functional,
whether its MyFaction or online matches, the game lets you connect to the 2k servers for a minute or two then stops communication.
I was sure this was a prelaunch issue but the issue was not fixed on launch day, and now it's a week later and still nothing. because I've waited hoping it would be fixed I am not eligible for a refund.

I have contacted 2k support, they tried convincing me it was an ISP issue even though it clearly wasn't, and only when I showed the steam thread of 200+ people confirming the issue they said the team was "aware" but refused to let me know if it was being worked on. this is so frustrating.
the worst part is that apparently this was also an issue in 2k22 that was never patched.

I would not buy the game until you get confirmation the server issue is fixed, if it ever will be. save your money for now.

I think this entry into the WWE 2k series is a great entry. The movement is extremely fluid, the fighting is crisp, and the atmosphere is a lot of fun to play in. The only issue I have is the online. The game is great, the online needs serious work

If you have played previous WWE 2K games, you'll be familiar with a few of my complaints. If you haven't, don't spend any money to find out for yourself, please.

This game is so clunky. Previous installments were clunky, but 2K23 feels especially bad. Moves constantly miss because your opponent is seemingly always just far away enough for your strikes and grapples to not connect consistently, or sometimes they will barely connect and do weird animations. I don't know what makes my wrestler or opponent on the outside throw themselves into the announce table and take a bump, but there's always something weird happening with the animations because the wrestlers and objects (weapons, ring, ringside area) are so finicky when they interact with each other. (trying to move around or do much of anything with tables, weapon shots are still slow and wonky looking, sometimes items stop you in place or the referee can't figure out how to move them)

Opponents don't stay down long enough to accomplish much of anything without being "stunned", but that takes some time to do. And because the controls/environments are so clunky I often feel I'm scrambling to do a move under the just so conditions before my opponent is out of position and on offense (again). This is especially evident in showcase mode, where you're constantly tasked with specific moves and objectives. The fight for particular objectives was always outweighing any "fun" about the mode itself. Then I unlocked bonus showcase mode, which is where another of my issues comes in. 

Without giving spoilers, that entire "mode" is just poor game design. It's incredibly lame/overdone memes mixed in with a by design, ultra difficult set of matches. But the things that are done there are so visually off putting  and create unfair difficulty with the overpumped AI. It wants to laugh at you as much as it wants to punish you, and that creates an inherently not fun situation. They took one of my favorite things about last year, and just made it worse in near every possible way. 

Would love to talk about MyFaction, since I paid for this game, but can't access the servers. So there's multiplayer and an entire other mode down. They probably locked the faction trophies behind a pay wall again this year anyway so maybe I didn't miss out.

MyRise is a joke. Other than the storyline content being bland on its own, it's so far been pretty linear and hand holdy. I don't feel any consequence for winning or losing because the game is just going to force me into the next uninteresting scenario until I've checked off every generic "WWE superstar goal" or done every offbeat "request" for the fictional NPCs. (Also they made this NPC rewards thing ridiculous, I had an overall 81 by my 5th or so match, 2nd week into the mode)

What foundation 2K has with this series, in my opinion is not very good. They seem to be more concerned with adding gimmicks and cash grabs than finding a formula for improvement and sticking to it. They may be trying to do too much extra than what they can handle each year. I don't know, but it feels to me like they just don't care. Makes me sad because I've enjoyed these games a long time. Hopefully some day 2K can hand the reigns off to a more invested or better equipped company.

Update - was able to enter the myfaction menu. It will usually allow a "login" but if I try to do anything but Faction wars, I get error coded and told the servers can't be reached. Then I can't access any online features until I restart the game. So I can't grow my team, and the 4v4 tag AI is worse than last year. Near impossible to get an uninterrupted pin/submission on either side. 2K and whoever developed 4V4 in this game should be ashamed.

Often unable to play online and there are a few bugs here and there. Specifically: 
- The final match of the showcase had an issue where it cut to my opponent winning as soon as the entrances had completed. Also the opponent was not wearing the correct outfit, workaround was to quit and restart the match
- When playing the Universe mode as a superstar sometimes the match labels were incorrect, e.g. it would display as a tag team match then on the next screen it would be a singles match but my tag team partner was my manager. 
- When playing the Universe mode as a superstar there was occasionally an issue where I could not seek a championship match, the game would simply crash. On restarting Universe mode with a different superstar this did not happen.
- The game doesn't seem to like unconventional monitor setups - if I connected my PC to a second/ external monitor the game would not launch properly with an error message suggesting there was no display to connect to.

Having said all of this, the game delivers on many fronts. The presentation is excellent, the breadth of the roster is great, the showcase mode was really enjoyable and there are a couple of fun surprises in there. In many ways the game is exactly what I hoped it would be.
