Best 2K WWE game in my opinion since 2013.

*Alright* game so far, haven't had any crashes as of yet personally.

My main gripes with this game though is that the overall gameplay feels incredibly janky and unrealistic. The "instant recovery" system is the epitome of jank in this game. There's zero reason why someone should be able to get hit with multiple finishers and instantly get up just because their signature meter is full enough. It completely ruins the flow of the match and can put your opponent in a position to win simply because they pressed a single button before you pinned them. I get that 2K23 is supposed to be more arcadey than 2K19 was, but the matches flow terribly and the jankiness of the gameplay can be rage inducing. At the very least 2K needs to make people stay down longer. I'd say a good 75% of the time your opponent will just get up right away no matter how long the match has been going unless you hit a strong move. And even if you hit a strong move, there's a chance they'll just use instant recovery and get up anyways.

In my opinion, if you're looking for a wrestling simulator 2K23 simply isn't it. Buy or stick with 2K19.

But as for positives, 2K23 looks great and is a huge step up from 2K19. A lot of the models are impressively spot on and you can tell 2K put a lot of work into making this game look great. But as I said before, the gameplay is incredibly janky and it takes away from the fun of the game. You can't really have a realistic match in this game because of how janky the gameplay is.

The game's been enjoyable so far, but at times it becomes a chore to play simply because of how difficult it is to have a semi-realistic match. Half the time it doesn't even seem like you're doing damage to your opponent because they just no sell it.

So TL;DR:
- If you want a wrestling sim, buy or stick with 2K19 and skip this game.
- If you just want a wrestling game in general, sure go for it.
- If you want a wrestling jankfest that rivals the PS2 games in terms of jankiness, absolutely buy 2K23.

Comparing this years iteration against last years:

It's a lot better optimized, but not a lot has changed. In fact this years MyRise is pretty lackluster. That's not to say its bad arcs its just underwhelming last years story arc was a bit more engaging.

Customization seems to have taken a few more strides in the right direction however the UI/implementation could be a bit better: for example like other iterations: you're myrise character is unique to the mode: you cannot use you're created myrise character in other game modes without creating a new/duplicate character. Wouldn't be a huge deal if they offered some kind of import/export or copy/paste to add your My Rise characters to the "roster".

I feel like the entrance customization is awaiting some patchwork too: firework sounds aren't entirely lining up with your timing of pyros etc. Jukebox songs aren't included in this current patch but plans to add it in the future sort of thing.

But it's all still getting better and better with each iteration since the great debacle of 2k20. If GM mode is local multiplayer I just kind of wish it was "across steam/xbox/playstation" network multiplayer too I think that would be a fun mode to play with friends "competitive gms"

Ultimately though It's a decent WWE 2k game. LOL but keep in mind it is a WWE 2k game.

There are positive changes, but they are small and iterative, nothing worth busting out your wallet for. If this is their plan going forward, just wait for 2K3X or however long it takes for them to release a complete experience without wasting $60+ a year hoping for meaningful additions.

At this current state of the game, I can't recommend this game. First, if you like to play online, wait for the server issues to be fixed before buying. If you're a loner and like single player like I do, here's your review:

Universe Mode: Is slightly improved from last year. You can set up rivalries with attached cut scenes to a certain plot, so you have ... somewhat... more freedom to do what you want. If you disable the auto rivalry you will have more freedom to make changes the way you want without the game throwing in random wrestlers to fill in the rivalry. So far all of the changes I made within universe have stayed saved with changes only being seen in matches that do not have rivalries attached to it. I have not tested with CAS added to the universe yet. It's a good improvement but it's still lacking.

Last year I had a major issue with universe mode constantly resetting my changes, so this year, so far, all good with that.

MyGM: You can have up to 4 GMs either all human or with 3 CPU users. You can add mid tier titles the same way you could add tag team titles like last year, so same set-up with that. You can NOT change the championship designs like you can with universe mode. Aside from the usual shows they now added WCW and NXT 2.0 as shows to play in. Wrestlers are more prone to getting upset if they're not happy with how things are going and will threaten to either demand more money or quit the show.  Those are the changes I've seen so far in the mode.

MyFaction: Don't really care about the mode as well as the others.

You will have to unlock other wrestlers within the other two game modes with the Cena mode and My Rise even if you purchased to unlock everything. 

My Verdict is 6/10. It's just slightly improved from last year with better lighting. The game has crashed on me a few times already, but each time it did was in online trying to download CAS and not during gaming. If you feel the game is still a buy then go for it.

(Steam Deck Review)
As someone who has played almost every wwe game on existence, from Wrestlemania 2000 to Smackdown Vs Raw. 
Wwe2K23 has lived up to its hype. The graphics have proven to be the best thing about this game along with the revamped combo system, Improved AI fighting, brought back some fan favorite modes. 

I managed to Pre Order and play early so here is my review on my time playing since. 

Pros:

Graphics: Amazing. the lighting system gave the entrances the perfect touch.

MyRise: Upon writing this review I have recently finished my first run on MyRise as “The Lock” and what a wild experience it has been. The storyline was great although sometimes it does tend to drag, but when reaching a new chapter and being able to change the way the story goes with your choices makes a massive difference. Choosing between factions and paying the price afterwards gets you excited to see what’s next on your rise for the top. 

Universe: I have no dove into Universe much but the time I did spend on it I did enjoy choosing my specific superstar and going through universe that way. Very excited to see what’s to come. 

Myfaction: (will update when I decide to actually try it)

MyGM: also have not dove into. Will try soon. 

Cons:

A few cons I have ran into while only playing on the steam deck has been the performance when playing 6-8 players. So War Games is a hard miss to enjoy and play online. 

I have noticed crashing when only trying to create entrance videos so those who edit and make their custom titantrons will be unable to. 

Sometimes characters eyes go missing or pitche black during cutscenes and entrances. They come and go. I played all of MyRise dealing with an eyeless Shawn Michaels… almost.. like the real thing. 

Anyways that’s my review, the game is immensely fun and I recommend to try online and beat up your friends or randoms :) 

Steam Deck Review: 8/10 ✅

i found a fix for slow motion gameplay. go to C:\Users\User\Documents\WWE2K23 select config.ini and change below setting

 [quality]
audience_density = 100

to

[quality]
audience_density = 50

Lets start off with the PRO's of the game..
Let me start off by saying this....it is an improvement from 2k22 not going to take away from that.....The showcase mode with John Cena was amazing and I actually enjoyed it. I am not a fan of Cena, but the Showcase was the best by far. I enjoyed it and would happily play it again....The graphics, animations, lighting/smoke and the moves seem way more realistically smooth....the MyRise got a revamp with actual voice acting through and through...the Universe mode has been entertaining and fun.....with a few upgrades...again I cannot stress this improvement...the freakin GAMEPLAY is amazingly smooth and realistic as seen on tv and I think that's a massive improvement...the CAW's look so much better and just like the in-game wrestlers...

THE CON'S...
The blood is not realistic...looks like smeared crayon on the wrestlers face....it doesn't leak onto the wrestlers like previous SVR games...seems more forced like a "there you got it not stfu and enjoy it..." but they half ass it...
You still CANNOT do diving finishers off of ladders, cage, and other means other than the top rope....You cannot get create or "extreme" with weapons other than the ladder and table...there are no options to get creative as far as putting a chair on top of your opponent and doing a move like that...or doing all of RVD's chair stuff with other people other than RVD....the Custom Matches need to have an option for 6 man HIAC and War Games to have an elimination rules to allow more creativity and in depth matches....
The created entrances...you cannot change the view (camera angle) to fit certain point in your entrance without changing the entire thing...so often times...your pyro goes off and you cannot see it because the camera is all jacked up....if you do change the camera angle you are so far away the entrance just looks.....odd like you're in the nose bleed section...
I wish they would bring back the face paint wear and tear....
If i find anymore pro's and con's ill add them to here later...
the MYFACTION to me...its a waste of time and a wasted mode....but again...that's just me...
And we can't import music yet again......

none the less...its an improvement from last installment....

WWE 2k23 from the perspective of someone who has zero intent on playing as anyone but custom characters:

The Good:

Customization looks more realistic than last game. I felt like in the last game there was only one decent looking face for both genders and the rest looked kinda horrifying, but in this game, it's very possible to have a decent looking character with many different faces. There are a few more options but it's pretty much the same stuff from 2k22.

Lots of entrances and movesets, though the Kofi Kingston trombone, as always, will definitely not line up with your character's mouth and you just need to accept that reality. You can customize teams, and teams will not fight each other in Royal Rumbles unless they are the only ones left at the end. If they're waiting for someone else to show up, they'll just taunt. That's nice.

Lots of characters to unlock with in-game currency got through playing other modes (but not My Rise, for some reason). They come with new moves, entrances, and victory animations, so they're worth picking up. I'd personally recommend getting Andre the Giant and Undertaker early, since there are few base game characters that sort of slowly lumber into the stage and you might want that in your characters.

My Rise has an actual plot this time instead of just being a bunch of random occurances. I'm not sure if it has an end yet, but it feels a lot more focused than last time where you just kind of... did things and made your numbers uselessly go up.

War Games is crazy but fun. It's nice to see them playing with new match layouts, I'd like to see some that maybe aren't as possible in real life in the future, like shrinking arenas, referee soccer, or something else. Give the game some spice that only games can have.

Fanny is back!!! I know nobody cares but me but she's the real OG. I like the mission with her where you just do mocap and some studio guy gives bored commentary instead of having a referee. Solid setting

The Bad:

NPCs talking look so ugly, and this is very apparent in the female My Rise storyline where the aunt character's mouth opens way bigger than it should, and she looks like some freaky dinosaur when she talks. 

Teeth default to this weird grey color that looks really unnatural when you see it in the arena, so you need to customize teeth color. Eyes do the same, so you also need to make sure the whites of everyone's eyes look correct. 2k22 had better teeth by default, but the eyes were the same.

Mixed fights are reserved for very special modes, so it's not worth diversifying your custom characters. You pick men or women and stick with it, or limit the amount of fight combinations you have. 

The game starts to really struggle when customizing fat characters, especially when more than one character is on screen. I had multiple crashes on one 500 pound character, and the game really chugged when changing her outfit. Understandably, a game about buff men punching each other might not be playtested for the morbidly obese, but I'd like my morbidly obese character to try on several shirts before I commit, dang it.

The pay for cards modes are still very much front and center, and as before, they're an eyesore in a game that really focuses on pushing less fun modes over its more creative options. I'd pay for a DLC customization expansion with more generic stuff, but I'm not paying for more wrestler cards that I resolutely refuse to use.

The game, like launch 2k22, is unequipped to handle a wireless controller plugged into a computer. Your menuing will be fine, but your character will stand still in fights. This can be resolved by unplugging it, but after last year, one might assume that they'd have the fix ready on day one instead of waiting to fix it once again.

The "every time John Cena lost" mode is cool in theory, but in practice, you're in control of different characters each time, fighting the same boss. It's kind of a bad game design decision to make every single boss fight the same guy, and makes that mode drag a bit, which sucks because it was like half of their marketing for this game. If Soul Calibur did this for a story mode, I'd quit the story mode. Gotta diversify the fights, and I'd rather lose as John Cena than win against John Cena many, many times.

Still only one voice per gender, which is a bit below standard for similar games with customization. Even being able to change the grunt pitch would give a lot more diversity to these characters, since outside of My Rise, all they're doing is grunting and yelling anyways.

Logan Paul is in this game. I cannot take him out of this game.

They did it. After 10 long years, they finally made another good one.

It runs well on PC, it's packed with content, and the flow of matches is balanced (i.e. you get some hits, your opponent gets some hits) so it just feels right. There's very little lag to speak of when using the character creator now as well, so it's not like pulling teeth creating even a simple character. 

However, it has jank, for sure. Biggest pain so far is probably most multi-person matches. 2v2 tag is fine, but anymore than that gets very annoying to win. Relating to this, the MyFaction 4v4 matches are just awful and near-impossible to win via pinfall (tip: go for submission). 

Some of the MyFaction AI matches are unnecessarily difficult; basically you have to both win the match and do enough objectives during the match to actually win and claim a reward. In a 3v3 tag match on Legendary difficulty, this equates to getting 5 out of 6 objectives per person, which can take anywhere between 10 to 25 minutes depending on how the AI was balanced for that particular match (in some cases, they counter around 1 in 3 attacks).

But overall, very good game. If you've been snoozing on the franchise because of some lacklustre additions in the past, this is the one to pick it up again.

I must commend 2k for producing a masterpiece in the form of Showcase. My experience with this game far surpassed my expectations, and I am truly grateful for the opportunity to explore John Cena's memories, which inspired him to become the ultimate legend of WWE. As a huge fan of both Brock Lesnar and The Rock, I am also grateful for the different variants of their characters that were included in the game.

I want to bring to your attention an important issue I recently encountered while playing this game. I noticed that if I turn on the option of "Targeting Referee," I am able to perform moves on the referee during the match. The strange thing is that a female athlete can hurt a male referee, while a male athlete cannot hurt a female referee. This is unfair and goes against the principles of equality and respect. In the game, a female athlete should not be able to perform moves on a male referee. I urge the game developers to improve this aspect of the game to maintain fairness and respect.

Game has been so far, haven't had any crazy bugs yet. They need to fix controller detection in myrise mode, I have to unplug my keyboard for it to work. Other than that I definitely recommend it.

SAFE TO BUY!!!

On launch the only crash I have is when mass downloading creations.  Universe mode is excellent, gm mode is still trash but more options of trash make it a little better, and showcase is really fun just getting to smash out Cena over and over was a nice touch. MyRise I have not played much of nor much in creation but this is some polished game play.

I'm a decent way into the game and loving it. A lot of refinement of little details this time around that rounds out last year's solid foundation. Simple things like taker rolling his eyes and sticking his tongue out during a pin. There's a lot of little nuance improvements like that.

Graphics are noticeably better and videos don't do it justice. CAWs (if you don't make a monster lol) are indistinguishable from IRL wrestlers. Like truly impressive stuff here. Still no ability to fine tune the body morph, like last year - BUT advanced entrance creation is back with timed pyro etc.

Universe has a really cool new feature where each person in a rivalry has different "stipulations" that happen such as loser leaves town, or injuring the opponent, even mutual respect or fighting spirit moments. A dice roll happens before each match that determines which opponents stipulation occurs and the stips evolve over the course of the timeline. This essentially makes heels feel more like heels and vice versa. Also gives me a reason to want to play each weekly show instead of just simulating until a PPV.  Great addition IMO.

War Games. That's it, thats the paragraph. War Games. Its fucking lit.

Sound design is great, I still muted the menu songs pretty quickly though.

MyFaction has multi-player now, making it function more closely to a Madden Ultimate Team kinda thing. It's fun, I dig it.

Online servers are BETTER but still not good. Less input lag during online matches but still so many disconnects. Might be fixed in time.

I thought I'd hate the Cena showcase but it was fire. Didn't take itself too seriously, and completing it grants Super Cena's invisible model. Funny, fun and unlocks a whole host of people I'm glad to see in the game again (shout out bald Orton from 09 with the punt kick).

All in all, it feels like a love letter to wrestling games and an all around improvement from 2k22. Icon edition was well worth it (to me, being a ruthless aggression fan).

TLDR: If you enjoyed 2k22 at all, you will enjoy 2k23 more.

I'm Really liking WWE 2K23 so far! 2K took what was great in 2K22 and improved upon it further in 2K23. The MyRise mode has two really great careers to do (male and female) and it's even more in depth this year and super fun so far. The Showcase mode is also really good just like it was last year. In Terms of bugs I haven't actually ran into any yet, but I have noticed that (as of launch) whenever I perform a move on my opponent that initiates a special camera angle it tends to lag my framerate a bit, but when the camera goes back to the normal "side view" the frames come back. Hopefully that will get fixed soon since it's a pretty small problem. I Also think the soundtrack is pretty good this year too! 2K22 had some amazing songs too (Happy Song -BMTH, Protect Ya Neck -WuTang Clan, Typhoons -Royal Blood, Heartless -The Weeknd), and this year we've got some really cool artists on hear as well (Metallica, Bullet For My Valentine, Post Malone Ft. Travis Scott & Ozzy Ozbourne, Red Hot Chilli Peppers) However this year I did disable a couple songs, those being the spanish rap songs that I didn't really dig all that much. Overall I'd give the game an 8.5/10 so far! It's really fun and I can't wait to hop into the other modes that I enjoyed a lot in 2K22, and even try out the multiplayer a bit.

Best 2K game in a while.

Great game, Ai could be better in tag matches and I hate the fact that the bloodline didn't get a 3 man entrance like the judgement day got. Hell in the cell and ladder matches still need a rework and like I said the tag AI could be better in terms of self awareness and in terms of when they see their tag member about to get hit with a finisher. Overall I give this game a 85 its better than last years game and I cant wait for some mods to come out for this game. I also wanted to point out that its always worth it to get this game early so you can download the caws before users delete them or 2KSports remove them for copyright. I'm glad they kept the manual kick out system from their previous games, makes simulating matches better when you are playing vs the ai. Ladder matches need a rework, it needs to be way harder to grab the case or belts, I feel those matches go to quick. Still no 4vs4 tornado, come on 2K how hard is it to make this match? its freaking 2023 and still no 4vs4 tornado. I would also like to see the crawl system return like in 2k19 where you can go towards the ropes while on the ground.

So far it seems like an improvement over 2K22 and surprisingly 2K20. Most people didn't like 2K20 because of the bugs and lightning which made faces look worse than they actually were, however it did have more features than 2K22 which fixed the bugs but cut some content. Now I see those cut options like custom entrances, mixed gender stables and others back for this year.

I also didn't experience any major bugs for the first 20 hours and counting. There can still be some visual ones like custom hair dye not appearing during entrances then working as normal during the match.

This can be my imagination, but crowd chants and commentary seem more appropriate and well timed. The commentary seems to have more triggers which is good for the timing I mentioned, but it creates moments where it's cut short due to a new move you or the opponent is doing.

Stamina is there however it's hidden and you only notice it when your wrestler has a blue wheel above their head which is getting depleted with each move, you only have to stop for a couple of seconds or do a taunt to get it back up so it very rarely gets in the way.

There was an effort made for the moves to line up better, especially jumping from the top rope, this works great most of the time. I'm just having trouble with jumping moves that target a specific body part like the head. I made my CAW finisher one such move and it often doesn't connect then refunds the finisher charge back. One time the ref was standing next to the opponent and got hit instead and I died laughing. The move is basically jump and land on the head of the opponent with your ass so the ref getting sat on his head while standing up is pure gold :D

When going through My Rise (story mode) you can change the face of your CAW completely which I really like, however the body type as well as height and weight still can't be changed once you create the wrestler for the first time so make sure you get this right.

Overall I would call this a straight up upgrade to 2K22 and I was crazy enough to buy the Icon Edition. The price on that is honestly way too high. Don't be crazy like me, type in Google WWE 2K23 DLC and you can see a list of all the planned DLC for this game. If you like it, get the Deluxe Edition for the season pass. If not, get the standard one.

If you are looking for a completely different game compared to 2K22 skip this, it's the same game with more polish, some new features and some returning features from older games. This is too long already, but you can check online and find a list of the new features if you want.

I pay this tax each year since wrestling hooked me with the attitude era when I was a kid, but you don't have to be like me :)

This honestly feels like a step up from last year's game.
Not a complete pole-vault up a flight of stairs like 2k22 was over 2k20, but a reasonable improvement nonetheless.

Fighting feels more responsive,

Character creation feels more fluid (doesn't freeze as much or as long),

This is purely subjective, but this year's menu music choices are much better. (If I never hear "Survival" by Eminem again it'll be too soon),

Having a lot more options for AI interactions is great. Percentage chance to use weapons, top rope moves, etc.

Seeing War Games added as a match type is exciting, but I feel like most of the marketing was so hyper-focused on it that people have overlooked all of the other positive changes in this year's edition.

A more fleshed-out version of GM Mode is always good news to me. It's become one of my favorite minigames in the franchise. It almost makes me wish that WWE would produce a stand-alone WWE: General Manager game that really goes ham with the concept.

I can't speak to the quality of the trading-card style game that's been in the past couple iterations of the game, it's just not my thing. I have friends that've said it's a good time, for what it's worth.

Also, Nikita Lyons. Yes.
my standards for 2k games are very low lmao, but it's better than last year and it's all I need from a wrestling game, fun to play stoned or while listening to music.

[h1]Deutsch[/h1]

Es ist besser als WWE 2K22, auf jeden Fall. 2K geht immer mehr in die richtige Richtung.

Was unbedingt verbessert werden muss:
GM Modus muss das Klassensystem entfernen!!
Geht immer noch nicht online (dafür aber Steam Remote Play mit bis zu 4 Spielern)

-Special Referee
-Inferno Match

-3vs3vs3vs3
-5-Man Tag

Backstage müssen sie noch weiter ausarbeiten, sie haben ein paar Animationen reingemacht, sind aber im Großen und Ganzen die gleichen (am Auto)..Baut Backstage aus, lasst uns rumfahren etc. wie damals!

Weapon Taunts - muss ausgebaut werden und etwas realistischer - nimmt Euch die Zeit und steckt Liebe und Detail in Kleinigkeiten, das wird sich lohnen.

Beim ankündigen sieht man, dass es ein Bild ist mit ein bisschen Animationen, was dann zu einem anderen Bild mit Jubel wechselt - sehr schlecht gemacht.

Ein What If Modus wäre absolut geil, gerne auch einen Fanaufruf starten mit Ideen oder nimmt Euch Fans mit ins Boot.

Was bereits gut ist:
-Gameplay

Hey 2K, I know you probably won't read this and are probably focusing way too much on how much money MyFaction could make you. But there's definitely some issues I would like to point out.

1. The fact you have a logic system, but every wrestler wrestles the same unless I personally go in and fix it. It's not my job to make your game, the Fire Pro devs, when adding logic systems to their games, always make sure that the wrestlers in the game should wrestle sort of how they do, maybe not perfectly, but they do use their own logic systems when creating defaults for the games. It's not my job to fix your game.

2. The reversal system seems absolutely borked compared to how it was last year. I've noticed times where I'm unable to reverse anything at all for long stretches of matches, which basically guarantees a loss. This is more likely to happen the higher the difficulty is too. Meanwhile, the AI is able to reverse everything and will reverse everything. There's a difference between making things harder and making things cheap. But this is a flaw with the series as a whole.

3. The whole "MyFaction is worked on by a smaller team, so we can't import the characters in from it" is such an excuse. It's not like the model system is different in that mode to every other mode. Why is it so hard to import character parts?

4.I miss getting a bunch of new indie moves every year, with again no promised "New Moves Pack" this year, you only added like 2-3 moves not used by wrestlers within the WWE. This hampers CAW creation. What is the reason why you've stopped doing it? Is it too expensive to rent the Mocap studio for more time?

5. Some of the tron placements in classic arenas are completely wrong. The smackdown fist arena has the tron playing in the entryway when it should be playing on the screens next to the fist. Then again, that was an issue in the Create An Arena when you tried to use the Fist arena there too. It's a minor detail, I know, but it looks wrong and it bothers me.

Note, this negative review doesn't mean I'm not having fun. I just wanted to point out the absolute laziness of the devs, which is part of a problem with the entire games industry and "sports" genre as a whole (They see these games as sports games, which is why they give the least amount of effort, they think they have the Madden demographic, but they don't realize that Wrestling fans are their own breed). Beyond these little ticks, I am having a good amount of fun. But please, either go back and patch this sort of stuff or fix it in the next game. Just because you think people will buy this game yearly because they feel obligated to, doesn't mean they will stick around. The minor details absolutely matter.

Edit: Because "HOW DARE I ASK FOR AUTHENTICITY" I'm going to bring up more small issues that bother me.

-Wrestlers go for pins and subs way too much, especially on harder difficulties

-The "balancing" section barely changes jack

-It seems that almost all of them have the Achilles Lock for their standing submission. More wrestlers use it than not and that makes no sense since a submission like that should really be for more technical guys

-The personality system created for previous games seems to have gone out the window and they are just words in profiles 

I'm allowed to care about details. Getting mad at me because I'm judging a game as a game and not as a secular religion that you consume yearly like some Maddendrone isn't going to change my mind.
Judge your video games harsher. Actually give a shit.

Purchased the Icon Edition and right off the bat, it's probably the best WWE game in the last several iterations. It's not without it's problems. 

The online seems to always be unavailable. Restarting the game usually fixes this untill it happens again. 

Booking title matches in GM mode have to be single matches, for some reason they dont allow 3 or 4 way title matches. Also in GM mode the match types are very restricted, and the AI GM is OP again. 

Playing matches seems to be much smoother in this game than past ones. Controls feel more responsive.

The MyFaction mode reminds me of Madden. Sorry, that's not to say I don't like it, but it is what it is.

To me it really seems the gameplay is easier. So keep that in mind if you like to be challenged.

Overall I've been enjoying the game quite a bit. The online not working properly is annoying but aside from that and the few issues I mentioned above, it's a solid game. I've only had one crash in my playtime and it was while trying to do something online. I HAVE NOT SEEN ANY OTHER BUGS! I know some people have had issues but I personally have not seen any. 

For reference, Im running the game on max settings with the following specs - 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-12400F   2.50 GHz, 16.0 GB (15.8 GB usable) Ram, Nvidia Geforce RTX 3060, Win 11.

It works on Steam Deck flawlessly.

Solid effort this year. While the Legends roster was a bit mid. It's pretty damn good. The occasional bug (To be expected from 2K) but nothing that's changed the enjoyment factor. New pin system is interesting, and the selling animations are quite a nice touch. 

As someone who is stuck in the 80's, 90's and early 2000's eras of wrestling I wish there was an option for more Legends DLC packs. I would gladly throw my money at them, but I get it. Licencing issues are always a thing when it comes to wrestling games.

Key highlights for me personally: 

- The graphics are a nice step up especially maxed out at 4K. 
- Lighting improvements are tenfold over last year
- Loading times are quite nice with stock wrestlers (Have not loaded up a ton of CAW's yet, 
so there is a bit of concern over this much like last year) 
- Universe is as good as ever. 
- It's been running flawlessly on the Steam Deck with medium settings without going into 
offline mode like we had to last year even though 2K stated they were not going to be supporting
the Steam Deck this year.

It's 2k22 with meaningful improvements to a few modes. MyGM got a massive update that made the mode much more fleshed out. Universe mode got an update to the rivalry system that makes rivalries much more unique., Overall if you enjoyed 2k22, you'll like this one.

No fix has been found. I have contacted 2k Support. They have been able to help thus far. My internet is definitely not the issue as every other game works perfectly fine online. 

I do not care much for the offline content, so I cannot give this game a positive review.

I put a positive review, but there are a few little things in my opinion, they are not critical, but I think that it is the little things that make up the overall impression of the game.
1. the game has become much faster in terms of downloads, I can not compare with the previous part with WWE2K22, but after playing all the previous parts since WWE2K15 and compared to them, the game is much better
2. On the technical side, there were almost no problems. 1 time the game hung, the task manager helped and dealt with it and the connection with the game server is often lost, writes a connection error. compared to WWE2K20, which was very problematic at the start, everything here is not even bad
3. For me, the new control system is debatable, personally, I could not immediately get used to it, the game itself has become much more dynamic and faster, and this cannot but rejoice
Summing up, I see a positive trend in the development of the series, but there are little things that are not critical, but still, for example, is it really difficult to implement the display of 2 or more titles on a wrestler upon release, especially since this has already been implemented in one or several parts of a series

awesome game

It's basically WWE 2K22 version 1.5 with a roster update. Don't expect too much changes. However the game builds on the already good foundation of 2K22 and improves a lot of things. Graphics are better, especially the player models and caws. Advanced entrance creation is back. Load times are a bit quicker everywhere, but still present in most menus. Animations and transitions between moves look more smooth. AI vs AI matches also are better. GM mode had various improvements but there are still things left to be desired. For example, they added triple threat and fatal 4 way to GM mode, but for some reason you can't have title matches in those match types. Maybe they will fix this in an upcoming patch hopefully. 

If you enjoyed 2K22 and want a roster update and overall improved game and don't mind the cost, I'd say it's worth it. It's probably the best WWE game since 2K took ownership of the brand. If you are expecting big changes and improvements then maybe you should wait anoterh 2 years or so.
